page.title: 12STOCKLAND SCHOOL
page.content: Stockland School is beautifully set in the heart of tha Devon countryside. It was originally built in 1859,by the church.It is a Voluntary Controlled School for Primary children aged between 5 and 11.At present there are 86 on roll,divided into four classes. It still maintains firm links with the church situated nearby.The pupils come from a large catchment area,which includes Yarcombe,Marsh,Buckland St. Mary as well as Stockland.In July 1965 the local school at Yarcombe was closed and now children are bussed daily from here.The site enjoys a large field,gardens used for environmental education,a pond,and a swimming-pool.IT is well supported by an active P.T.F.A.<Parents Teachers Friends Association>.
